entities.name: riak-ee-node
entities.description: An optimized Basho Riak Enterprise single-node deployment

config.name: children.startable.mode
config.description: Controls behaviour when starting Startable children as part of this entity's lifecycle.
config.label: children.startable.mode

config.name: customize.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking customize until ready
config.label: customize.latch

config.name: dontRequireTtyForSudo
config.description: Whether to explicitly set /etc/sudoers, so don't need tty (will leave unchanged if 'false'); some machines require a tty for sudo; brooklyn by default does not use a tty (so that it can get separate error+stdout streams); you can enable a tty as an option to every ssh command, or you can do it once and modify the machine so that a tty is not subsequently required.
config.label: dontRequireTtyForSudo

config.name: download.addon.urls
config.description: URL patterns for downloading named add-ons (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.addon.urls

config.name: download.url
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url

config.name: download.url.debian
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux Debian installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.debian

config.name: download.url.mac
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the MAC binaries tarball (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.mac

config.name: download.url.rhelcentos
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux RPM installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.rhelcentos

config.name: download.url.ubuntu
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux Ubuntu installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.ubuntu

config.name: entity.running
config.description: Skip the startup process entirely, if service already running
config.label: entity.running

config.name: entity.started
config.description: Skip the startup process entirely, for running services
config.label: entity.started

config.name: epmdListenerPort
config.description: Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Listener Port
config.label: epmdListenerPort

config.name: erlangPortRangeEnd
config.description: Erlang Port Range End
config.label: erlangPortRangeEnd

config.name: erlangPortRangeStart
config.description: Erlang Port Range Start
config.label: erlangPortRangeStart

config.name: expandedinstall.dir
config.description: Directory for installed artifacts (e.g. expanded dir after unpacking .tgz)
config.label: expandedinstall.dir

config.name: files.install
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir
config.label: files.install

config.name: files.preinstall
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir
config.label: files.preinstall

config.name: files.runtime
config.description: Mapping of files, to be copied before customisation, to destination name relative to runDir
config.label: files.runtime

config.name: handoffListenerPort
config.description: Handoff Listener Port
config.label: handoffListenerPort

config.name: httpMonitoring.enabled
config.description: HTTP(S) monitoring enabled
config.label: httpMonitoring.enabled

config.name: inboundPorts.autoInfer
config.description: If set to false turns off the opening of ports based on naming convention, and also those that are of type PortRange in Java entities
config.label: inboundPorts.autoInfer

config.name: inboundPorts.configRegex
config.description: Regex governing the opening of ports based on config names
config.label: inboundPorts.configRegex

config.name: install.dir
config.description: Directory for this software to be installed in
config.label: install.dir

config.name: install.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking install until ready
config.label: install.latch

config.name: install.skip
config.description: Skip the driver install commands entirely, for pre-installed software
config.label: install.skip

config.name: install.unique_label
config.description: Provides a label which uniquely identifies an installation, used in the computation of the install dir; this should include something readable, and must include a hash of all data which differentiates an installation (e.g. version, plugins, etc), but should be the same where install dirs can be shared to allow for re-use
config.label: install.unique_label

config.name: install.version
config.description: Version to install (Default 2.0.5)
config.label: install.version

config.name: java.check.hostname.bug
config.description: Check whether hostname is too long and will likely crash Javadue to bug 7089443
config.label: java.check.hostname.bug

config.name: java.opts
config.description: Java command line options
config.label: java.opts

config.name: java.sysprops
config.description: Java command line system properties
config.label: java.sysprops

config.name: java.version.required
config.description: Java version required
config.label: java.version.required

config.name: launch.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking launch until ready
config.label: launch.latch

config.name: metrics.usage.retrieve
config.description: Whether to retrieve the usage (e.g. performance) metrics
config.label: metrics.usage.retrieve

config.name: openIptables
config.description: Whether to open the INBOUND_PORTS via iptables rules; if true then ssh in to run iptables commands, as part of machine provisioning
config.label: openIptables

config.name: post.customize.command
config.description: Command to be run after the customize method being called on the driver
config.label: post.customize.command

config.name: post.install.command
config.description: Command to be run after the install method being called on the driver
config.label: post.install.command

config.name: post.launch.command
config.description: Command to be run after the launch method being called on the driver

config.name: pre.customize.command
config.description: Command to be run prior to the customize method being called on the driver

config.description: Command to be run prior to the install method being called on the driver
config.label: pre.install.command

config.name: pre.launch.command
config.description: Command to be run prior to the launch method being called on the driver
config.label: pre.launch.command

config.description: Custom properties to be passed in when provisioning a new machine

config.name: requiredOpenLoginPorts
config.description: The port(s) to be opened, to allow login
config.label: requiredOpenLoginPorts

config.name: resources.install.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking install resources until ready
config.label: resources.install.latch

config.name: resources.runtime.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking runtime resources until ready
config.label: resources.runtime.latch

config.name: riak.advancedConfig.templateUrl
config.description: URL of Template file (in freemarker format) for the advanced.config file
config.label: riak.advancedConfig.templateUrl

config.description: Template file (in freemarker format) for the app.config config file
config.label: riak.appConfig.templateUrl

config.description: Number of the open files required by Riak
config.label: riak.max.open.files

config.name: riak.networking.optimize
config.description: Optimize host networking when running in a VM
config.label: riak.networking.optimize

config.name: riak.os
config.description: The OS to request. Default is to auto-detect based on the download url and to ensure IP-tables and firewalls do not block Riak. Use 'none' to disable inferencing and firewall reconfiguration.
config.label: riak.os

config.name: riak.pbPort
config.description: Riak Protocol Buffers Port
config.label: riak.pbPort

config.name: riak.replication.cluster.manager.port
config.description: Cluster Manager Port
config.label: riak.replication.cluster.manager.port

config.name: riak.riakConf.additionalContent
config.description: Template file (in freemarker format) for setting up additional settings in the riak.conf file
config.label: riak.riakConf.additionalContent

config.name: riak.riakConf.templateUrl.linux
config.description: Template file (in freemarker format) for the app.config config file
config.label: riak.riakConf.templateUrl.linux

config.name: riak.riakConf.templateUrl.mac
config.description: Template file (in freemarker format) for the app.config config file
config.label: riak.riakConf.templateUrl.mac

config.name: riak.search
config.description: Deploy Solr and configure Riak to use it
config.label: riak.search

config.name: riak.vmArgs.templateUrl
config.description: Template file (in freemarker format) for the vm.args config file
config.label: riak.vmArgs.templateUrl

config.name: riak.webPort
config.description: Riak Web Port
config.label: riak.webPort

config.name: run.dir
config.description: Directory for this software to be run from
config.label: run.dir

config.name: search.solr.jmx_port
config.description: Solr port
config.label: search.solr.jmx_port

config.name: search.solr.port
config.description: Solr port
config.label: search.solr.port

config.name: setup.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking setup until ready
config.label: setup.latch

config.name: shell.env
config.description: Map of environment variables to pass to the runtime shell
config.label: shell.env

config.name: softwareProcess.lifecycleTasks
config.description: An object that handles lifecycle of an entity's associated machine.
config.label: softwareProcess.lifecycleTasks

config.name: softwareProcess.maxSensorRebindDelay
config.description: The maximum delay to apply when reconnecting sensors when rebinding to this entity. Brooklyn will wait a random amount of time, up to the value of this config key, to avoid a thundering herd problem when the entity shares its machine with several others. Set to null or to 0 to disable any delay.
config.label: softwareProcess.maxSensorRebindDelay

config.name: start.latch
config.description: Latch for blocking start until ready
config.label: start.latch

config.name: start.timeout
config.description: Time to wait for process and for SERVICE_UP before failing (in seconds, default 2m)
config.label: start.timeout

config.name: stopIptables
config.description: Whether to stop iptables entirely; if true then ssh in to stop the iptables service, as part of machine provisioning
config.label: stopIptables

config.name: templates.install
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before install, to destination name relative to installDir
config.label: templates.install

config.name: templates.preinstall
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before pre-install, to destination name relative to installDir
config.label: templates.preinstall

config.name: templates.runtime
config.description: Mapping of templates, to be filled in and copied before customisation, to destination name relative to runDir
config.label: templates.runtime

entities.name: riak-ee-cluster
entities.description:
A configured cluster of Basho Riak Enterprise nodes
optimized for the OS implied by the given download.url

config.name: cluster.initial.quorumSize
config.description: Initial cluster quorum size - number of initial nodes that must have been successfully started to report success (if < 0, then use value of INITIAL_SIZE)
config.label: cluster.initial.quorumSize

config.name: cluster.initial.size
config.description: Initial cluster size
config.label: cluster.initial.size

config.name: cluster.member.id
config.description: The unique ID number (sequential) of a member of a cluster
config.label: cluster.member.id

config.name: download.url
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url

config.name: download.url.debian
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux Debian installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.debian

config.name: download.url.mac
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the MAC binaries tarball (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.mac

config.name: download.url.rhelcentos
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux RPM installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.rhelcentos

config.name: download.url.ubuntu
config.description: URL pattern for downloading the linux Ubuntu installer (will substitute things like ${version} automatically)
config.label: download.url.ubuntu

config.name: dynamiccluster.availabilityZones
config.description: availability zones to use (if non-null, overrides other configuration)
config.label: dynamiccluster.availabilityZones

config.name: dynamiccluster.customChildFlags
config.description: Additional flags to be passed to children when they are being created
config.label: dynamiccluster.customChildFlags

config.name: dynamiccluster.factory
config.description: factory for creating new cluster members
config.label: dynamiccluster.factory

config.name: dynamiccluster.firstmemberspec
config.description: entity spec for creating new cluster members, used for the very first member if different
config.label: dynamiccluster.firstmemberspec

config.name: dynamiccluster.memberspec
config.description: entity spec for creating new cluster members
config.label: dynamiccluster.memberspec

config.name: dynamiccluster.numAvailabilityZones
config.description: number of availability zones to use (will attempt to auto-discover this number)
config.label: dynamiccluster.numAvailabilityZones

config.name: dynamiccluster.quarantineFailedEntities
config.description: If true, will quarantine entities that fail to start; if false, will get rid of them (i.e. delete them)
config.label: dynamiccluster.quarantineFailedEntities

config.name: dynamiccluster.quarantineFilter
config.description: Quarantine the failed nodes that pass this filter (given the exception thrown by the node). Default is those that did not fail with NoMachinesAvailableException (Config ignored if quarantineFailedEntities is false)
config.label: dynamiccluster.quarantineFilter

config.name: dynamiccluster.removalstrategy
config.description: strategy for deciding what to remove when down-sizing
config.label: dynamiccluster.removalstrategy

config.name: dynamiccluster.restartMode
config.description: How this cluster should handle restarts; by default it is disallowed, but this key can specify a different mode. Modes supported by dynamic cluster are 'off', 'sequqential', or 'parallel'. However subclasses can define their own modes or may ignore this.
config.label: dynamiccluster.restartMode

config.name: dynamiccluster.zone.enable
config.description: Whether to use availability zones, or just deploy everything into the generic location
config.label: dynamiccluster.zone.enable

config.name: dynamiccluster.zone.failureDetector
config.description: Zone failure detector
config.label: dynamiccluster.zone.failureDetector

config.name: dynamiccluster.zone.placementStrategy
config.description: Node placement strategy
config.label: dynamiccluster.zone.placementStrategy

config.name: enricher.service_state.children_and_members.quorum.running
config.description: Problems check from children actual states (lifecycle), applied by default to members and children, not checking upness, but requiring by default that none are on-fire
config.label: enricher.service_state.children_and_members.quorum.running

config.name: enricher.service_state.children_and_members.quorum.up
config.description: Up check, applied by default to members, requiring at least one present and up
config.label: enricher.service_state.children_and_members.quorum.up

config.name: group.members.delegate
config.description: Deprecated: Add delegate child entities for members of the group
config.label: group.members.delegate

config.name: group.members.delegate.nameFormat
config.description: Delegate members name format string (Use %s for the original entity display name)
config.label: group.members.delegate.nameFormat

config.name: provisioning.properties
config.description: Custom properties to be passed in when provisioning a new machine
config.label: provisioning.properties

config.name: riak.cluster.clusterName
config.description: Unique name of the cluster, used in multi-datacenter replication
config.label: riak.cluster.clusterName

config.name: riak.cluster.delayBeforeAdvertisingCluster
config.description: Delay after cluster is started before checking and advertising its availability
config.label: riak.cluster.delayBeforeAdvertisingCluster

config.name: riak.os
config.description: The OS to request. Default is to auto-detect based on the download url and to ensure IP-tables and firewalls do not block Riak. Use 'none' to disable inferencing and firewall reconfiguration.
config.label: riak.os

entities.name: Riak EE Fabric Wizard
entities.description:
A simple wizard for creating one or more optimized Basho Riak EE clusters.
You can supply multiple locations to generate multiple clusters 
with multi-cluster replication configured.
The download URL and initial size are advertised as parameters.
Additionally, any of the config keys from 
riak-ee-fabric, riak-ee-cluster, or riak-ee-node can be used.

config.name: riak.download.url
config.description:
The private download link for accessing Riak EE. 
The RHEL/CentOS or Ubuntu URLs can be used, and 
the OS will be autodetected.
config.label: Riak EE download URL

config.name: riak.cluster.size
config.description: The initial number of nodes for each Riak cluster
config.label: Cluster initial size

entities.name: Riak EE Cluster Template
entities.description:
A simple template for creating an optimized Basho Riak EE cluster,
for use in the YAML composer.
Edit the download.url and the location and use.
Additionally, any of the config keys from riak-ee-cluster can be used.
